question: What festival is also known as the Feast of Weeks?
explanation: Pentecost, or the Feast of Weeks, occurs 50 days after Passover and celebrates the harvest.

verses.kjv:
And ye shall count unto you from the morrow after the sabbath, from the day that ye brought the sheaf of the wave offering; seven sabbaths shall be complete:
Even unto the morrow after the seventh sabbath shall ye number fifty days; and ye shall offer a new meat offering unto the LORD.

question: What is the Festival of Booths (Tabernacles) meant to commemorate?
choices: Israel's dwelling in tents during the wilderness journey
The giving of the Ten Commandments
explanation: The Festival of Tabernacles commemorates when God made Israel live in temporary shelters during the Exodus.

verses.kjv:
That your generations may know that I made the children of Israel to dwell in booths, when I brought them out of the land of Egypt: I
am
 the LORD your God.

question: What festival celebrates the deliverance of the Jews from Haman's plot?
explanation: Purim celebrates how Esther and Mordecai saved the Jewish people from destruction.

verses.kjv:
Wherefore they called these days Purim after the name of Pur. Therefore for all the words of this letter, and
of that which they had seen concerning this matter, and which had come unto them,

question: What is the feast that celebrates the rededication of the temple during the Maccabean period?
explanation: The Feast of Dedication (Hanukkah) celebrates when the temple was cleansed and rededicated.

verses.kjv: And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication, and it was winter.

question: What were Israelites commanded to do on the Day of Atonement?
explanation: The Day of Atonement was a day to deny themselves, not work, and make atonement for sins.

verses.kjv:
Also on the tenth
day of this seventh month
there shall be a day of atonement: it shall be an holy convocation unto you; and ye shall afflict your souls, and offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
And ye shall do no work in that same day: for it
is a day of atonement, to make an atonement for you before the LORD your God.

question: What did Jewish men do three times a year according to the Law?
choices: Appear before the Lord in Jerusalem
explanation: Three times a year all men were to appear before the Lord at the place He chose: Passover, Pentecost, and Tabernacles.

verses.kjv: Three times in a year shall all thy males appear before the LORD thy God in the place which he shall choose; in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles: and they shall not appear before the LORD empty:

question: What were Jewish boys circumcised on according to the Law?
explanation: On the eighth day, the boy was to be circumcised as a sign of the covenant with God.

verses.kjv: And in the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.

question: What did Israelites build during the Feast of Tabernacles?
explanation: Live in temporary shelters for seven days to remember how I had the Israelites live in shelters.

verses.kjv: Ye shall dwell in booths seven days; all that are Israelites born shall dwell in booths:

question: What was the shofar made from?
explanation: Have seven priests carry trumpets of rams' horns in front of the ark.

verses.kjv: And seven priests shall bear before the ark seven trumpets of rams horns: and the seventh day ye shall compass the city seven times, and the priests shall blow with the trumpets.

question: What were firstfruits?
choices: The first portion of the harvest offered to God
explanation: Bring the best of the firstfruits of your soil to the house of the Lord your God.

verses.kjv: The first of the firstfruits of thy land thou shalt bring into the house of the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother’s milk.

question: How many days did God command Israel to celebrate Passover?
explanation: For seven days you are to eat bread made without yeast as part of the Passover celebration.

verses.kjv: Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread; even the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses: for whosoever eateth leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.

question: What were Jews required to give as a tithe?
explanation: A tithe of everything from the land, whether grain or fruit, belongs to the Lord; it is holy.

verses.kjv:
And all the tithe of the land,
whether of the seed of the land,
or of the fruit of the tree,
is the LORD’S:
it is holy unto the LORD.

question: How long did the Feast of Unleavened Bread last?
explanation: For seven days you are to eat bread made without yeast.

verses.kjv: Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread; even the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses: for whosoever eateth leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.

question: What were the Israelites commanded to build during the Feast of Tabernacles?
explanation: Live in temporary shelters for seven days during the Feast of Tabernacles.

verses.kjv: Ye shall dwell in booths seven days; all that are Israelites born shall dwell in booths:

question: What did the Israelites do on the Day of Atonement?
explanation: On the tenth day of the seventh month you must deny yourselves and not do any work.

verses.kjv:
And
this shall be a statute for ever unto you:
that
 in the seventh month, on the tenth
day of the month, ye shall afflict your souls, and do no work at all,
whether it be one of your own country, or a stranger that sojourneth among you:

question: What festival is also known as the Feast of Booths?
explanation: The Feast of Tabernacles (Sukkot) commemorates the Israelites dwelling in temporary shelters in the wilderness.

verses.kjv:
Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, The fifteenth day of this seventh month
shall be the feast of tabernacles
for seven days unto the LORD.

question: How many days does the Feast of Unleavened Bread last?
explanation: For seven days you are to eat bread made without yeast.

verses.kjv: Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread; even the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses: for whosoever eateth leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.

question: What is the holiest day in the Jewish calendar?
explanation: On this day atonement will be made for you, to cleanse you. Then, before the Lord, you will be clean from all your sins.

verses.kjv:
For on that day shall
the priest make an atonement for you, to cleanse you,
that ye may be clean from all your sins before the LORD.

question: What instrument was blown to announce festivals and special occasions?
explanation: On the first day of the seventh month you are to have a day of sabbath rest, a sacred assembly commemorated with trumpet blasts.

verses.kjv:
Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, In the seventh month, in the first
day of the month, shall ye have a sabbath, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, an holy convocation.

question: What festival celebrates Queen Esther saving the Jews?
explanation: These days were called Purim, from the word pur (lot), celebrating the Jews' deliverance from Haman's plot.

verses.kjv:
Wherefore they called these days Purim after the name of Pur. Therefore for all the words of this letter, and
of that which they had seen concerning this matter, and which had come unto them,

question: What did the high priest enter once a year on the Day of Atonement?
explanation: The Lord said to Moses: 'Tell Aaron not to come whenever he chooses into the Most Holy Place.'

verses.kjv:
And the LORD said unto Moses, Speak unto Aaron thy brother, that he come not at all times into the holy
place within the vail before the mercy seat, which
is upon the ark; that he die not: for I will appear in the cloud upon the mercy seat.

question: What feast lasted seven days and celebrated the fall harvest?
explanation: Say to the Israelites: 'On the fifteenth day of the seventh month the Lord's Festival of Tabernacles begins.'

verses.kjv:
Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, The fifteenth day of this seventh month
shall be the feast of tabernacles
for seven days unto the LORD.

question: What is the Day of Atonement called in Hebrew?
explanation: The tenth day of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement (Yom Kippur).

verses.kjv:
Also on the tenth
day of this seventh month
there shall be a day of atonement: it shall be an holy convocation unto you; and ye shall afflict your souls, and offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

question: What feast celebrates the wheat harvest?
explanation: Celebrate the Festival of Weeks with the firstfruits of the wheat harvest.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt observe the feast of weeks, of the firstfruits of wheat harvest, and the feast of ingathering at the year’s end.

question: How often was the Year of Jubilee to be celebrated?
explanation: Consecrate the fiftieth year and proclaim liberty throughout the land to all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee for you.

verses.kjv:
And ye shall hallow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout
all the land unto all the inhabitants thereof: it shall be a jubile unto you; and ye shall return every man unto his possession, and ye shall return every man unto his family.

question: What instrument was blown on the Feast of Trumpets?
explanation: Say to the Israelites: 'On the first day of the seventh month you are to have a day of sabbath rest, a sacred assembly commemorated with trumpet blasts.'

verses.kjv:
Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, In the seventh month, in the first
day of the month, shall ye have a sabbath, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, an holy convocation.

question: What were Israelites to do on the Day of Atonement?
explanation: The tenth day of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement. You must deny yourselves and present a food offering to the Lord.

verses.kjv:
Also on the tenth
day of this seventh month
there shall be a day of atonement: it shall be an holy convocation unto you; and ye shall afflict your souls, and offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

question: What does the Feast of Tabernacles commemorate?
choices: Israel living in temporary shelters in the wilderness
explanation: So your descendants will know that I had the Israelites live in temporary shelters when I brought them out of Egypt.

verses.kjv:
That your generations may know that I made the children of Israel to dwell in booths, when I brought them out of the land of Egypt: I
am
 the LORD your God.

question: What were the Israelites to eat with the Passover lamb?
explanation: That same night they are to eat the meat roasted over the fire, along with bitter herbs, and bread made without yeast.

question: What were the Israelites to do every seventh year?
explanation: But in the seventh year the land is to have a year of sabbath rest, a sabbath to the Lord. Do not sow your fields or prune your vineyards.

verses.kjv: But in the seventh year shall be a sabbath of rest unto the land, a sabbath for the LORD: thou shalt neither sow thy field, nor prune thy vineyard.

question: What happened to debts in the Year of Jubilee?
explanation: Consecrate the fiftieth year and proclaim liberty throughout the land to all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee for you; each of you is to return to your family property.

verses.kjv:
And ye shall hallow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout
all the land unto all the inhabitants thereof: it shall be a jubile unto you; and ye shall return every man unto his possession, and ye shall return every man unto his family.

question: What was done with the scapegoat?
explanation: The goat will carry on itself all their sins to a remote place; and the man shall release it in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And the goat shall bear upon him all their iniquities unto a land not inhabited: and he shall let go the goat in the wilderness.

question: What was offered on the Day of Atonement?
explanation: He is to take two goats and present them before the Lord. Aaron shall cast lots for the two goats—one lot for the Lord and the other for the scapegoat.

verses.kjv:
And he shall take the two goats, and present them before the LORD
at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And Aaron shall cast lots upon the two goats; one lot for the LORD, and the other lot for the scapegoat.

question: How many days did the Feast of Unleavened Bread last?
explanation: For seven days you are to eat bread made without yeast. On the first day remove the yeast from your houses.

verses.kjv: Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread; even the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses: for whosoever eateth leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.
